hustle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make someone move quickly, especially by pushing them roughly
hustle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I was hustled out of the building by a couple of security men.
hustle somebody into/out of/through etc something
He was hustled away by police officers.
hustle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to do something with a lot of energy and determination
hustle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Cindy’s not a great player, but she really hustles.
hustle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to hurry in doing something or going somewhere
hustle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: We need to hustle if we’re going to make this flight.
hustle.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to sell or obtain things in an illegal or dishonest way
hustle.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: thieves hustling stolen goods on the street
hustle.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to work as a prostitute, or to be in charge of prostitutes
hustle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: the hustle and bustle of the market place
hustle.translation[1].definitions[1].def: ways of getting money that involve cheating or deceiving people
hustle.translation[1].definitions[2].def: when someone does something quickly, with a lot of effort and eagerness
hustle.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The team has a lot of talent but no hustle.
